briefdescription.para: Runs on both Server and Client Networking is NOT initialized when this fires
Runs on both Server and Client Networking is NOT initialized when this fires
Runs on both Server and Client
Runs on both Server and Client
Set the frame rate for a headless server.

detaileddescription.para: Override if you wish to disable the behavior or set your own tick rate.

briefdescription.para: called when quitting the application by closing the window / pressing stop in the editor
This causes the server to switch scenes and sets the networkSceneName.

detaileddescription.para: Clients that connect to this server will automatically switch to this scene. This is called autmatically if onlineScene or offlineScene are set, but it can be called from user code to switch scenes again while the game is in progress. This automatically sets clients to be not-ready. The clients must call NetworkClient.Ready() again to participate in the new scene.

briefdescription.para: Called from ServerChangeScene immediately before SceneManager.LoadSceneAsync is executed

detaileddescription.para: This allows server to do work / cleanup / prep before the scene changes.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the scene that's about to be loaded

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a scene is completed loaded, when the scene load was initiated by the server with ServerChangeScene().

parameterdescription.para: The name of the new scene.

briefdescription.para: Called from ClientChangeScene immediately before SceneManager.LoadSceneAsync is executed

detaileddescription.para: This allows client to do work / cleanup / prep before the scene changes.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the scene that's about to be loaded
Scene operation that's about to happen
true to indicate that scene loading will be handled through overrides

briefdescription.para: Called on clients when a scene has completed loaded, when the scene load was initiated by the server.

detaileddescription.para: Scene changes can cause player objects to be destroyed. The default implementation of OnClientSceneChanged in the NetworkManager is to add a player object for the connection if no player object exists.

parameterdescription.para: The network connection that the scene change message arrived on.

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a new client connects.

detaileddescription.para: Unity calls this on the Server when a Client connects to the Server. Use an override to tell the NetworkManager what to do when a client connects to the server.

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a client is ready.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation of this function calls NetworkServer.SetClientReady() to continue the network setup process.

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a client adds a new player with ClientScene.AddPlayer.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation for this function creates a new player object from the playerPrefab.

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a client disconnects.

detaileddescription.para: This is called on the Server when a Client disconnects from the Server. Use an override to decide what should happen when a disconnection is detected.

briefdescription.para: Called on the server when a network error occurs for a client connection.
Called on the client when connected to a server.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation of this function sets the client as ready and adds a player. Override the function to dictate what happens when the client connects.

briefdescription.para: Called on clients when disconnected from a server.

detaileddescription.para: This is called on the client when it disconnects from the server. Override this function to decide what happens when the client disconnects.

briefdescription.para: Called on clients when a network error occurs.
Called on clients when a servers tells the client it is no longer ready.

detaileddescription.para: This is commonly used when switching scenes.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked when a host is started.

detaileddescription.para: StartHost has multiple signatures, but they all cause this hook to be called.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked when a server is started - including when a host is started.

detaileddescription.para: StartServer has multiple signatures, but they all cause this hook to be called.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked when the client is started.
This is called when a host is stopped.
This is called when a server is stopped - including when a host is stopped.
This is called when a client is stopped.
Called on server from StartServer to initialize the Authenticator

detaileddescription.para: Server message handlers should be registered in this method.

briefdescription.para: Called on server from OnServerAuthenticateInternal when a client needs to authenticate
Called on client from StartClient to initialize the Authenticator

detaileddescription.para: Client message handlers should be registered in this method.

briefdescription.para: Called on client from OnClientAuthenticateInternal when a client needs to authenticate
This is invoked for NetworkBehaviour objects when they become active on the server.

detaileddescription.para: This could be triggered by NetworkServer.Listen() for objects in the scene, or by NetworkServer.Spawn() for objects that are dynamically created.
This will be called for objects on a "host" as well as for object on a dedicated server.

briefdescription.para: Invoked on the server when the object is unspawned

detaileddescription.para: Useful for saving object data in persistant storage

briefdescription.para: Called on every NetworkBehaviour when it is activated on a client.

detaileddescription.para: Objects on the host have this function called, as there is a local client on the host. The values of SyncVars on object are guaranteed to be initialized correctly with the latest state from the server when this function is called on the client.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on clients when the server has caused this object to be destroyed.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used as a hook to invoke effects or do client specific cleanup.

briefdescription.para: Called when the local player object has been set up.

detaileddescription.para: This happens after OnStartClient(), as it is triggered by an ownership message from the server. This is an appropriate place to activate components or functionality that should only be active for the local player, such as cameras and input.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on behaviours that have authority, based on context and NetworkIdentity.hasAuthority.

detaileddescription.para: This is called after OnStartServer and before OnStartClient.

When NetworkIdentity.AssignClientAuthority is called on the server, this will be called on the client that owns the object. When an object is spawned with NetworkServer.Spawn with a NetworkConnection parameter included, this will be called on the client that owns the object.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on behaviours when authority is removed.

detaileddescription.para: When NetworkIdentity.RemoveClientAuthority is called on the server, this will be called on the client that owns the object.

briefdescription.para: Callback used by the visibility system to determine if an observer (player) can see this object.

detaileddescription.para: If this function returns true, the network connection will be added as an observer.

simplesect.para: True if the player can see this object.

briefdescription.para: Callback used by the visibility system to (re)construct the set of observers that can see this object.

detaileddescription.para: Implementations of this callback should add network connections of players that can see this object to the observers set.

parameterdescription.para: The new set of observers for this object.
True if the set of observers is being built for the first time.

briefdescription.para: This is called on the server when the server is started - including when a host is started.
This is called on the server when the server is stopped - including when a host is stopped.
This is called on the host when a host is started.
This is called on the host when the host is stopped.
This is called on the server when a new client connects to the server.
This is called on the server when a client disconnects.
This is called on the server when a networked scene finishes loading.
This allows customization of the creation of the room-player object on the server.

detaileddescription.para: By default the roomPlayerPrefab is used to create the room-player, but this function allows that behaviour to be customized.

parameterdescription.para: The connection the player object is for.

briefdescription.para: This allows customization of the creation of the GamePlayer object on the server.

detaileddescription.para: By default the gamePlayerPrefab is used to create the game-player, but this function allows that behaviour to be customized. The object returned from the function will be used to replace the room-player on the connection.

parameterdescription.para: The connection the player object is for.
The room player object for this connection.

briefdescription.para: This allows customization of the creation of the GamePlayer object on the server.

detaileddescription.para: This is only called for subsequent GamePlay scenes after the first one.
See OnRoomServerCreateGamePlayer to customize the player object for the initial GamePlay scene.

parameterdescription.para: The connection the player object is for.

briefdescription.para: This is called on the server when it is told that a client has finished switching from the room scene to a game player scene.

detaileddescription.para: When switching from the room, the room-player is replaced with a game-player object. This callback function gives an opportunity to apply state from the room-player to the game-player object.

simplesect.para: False to not allow this player to replace the room player.

briefdescription.para: This is called on the server when all the players in the room are ready.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation of this function uses ServerChangeScene() to switch to the game player scene. By implementing this callback you can customize what happens when all the players in the room are ready, such as adding a countdown or a confirmation for a group leader.

briefdescription.para: This is called on the server when CheckReadyToBegin finds that players are not ready

detaileddescription.para: May be called multiple times while not ready players are joining

briefdescription.para: This is a hook to allow custom behaviour when the game client enters the room.
This is a hook to allow custom behaviour when the game client exits the room.
This is called on the client when it connects to server.
This is called on the client when disconnected from a server.
This is called on the client when a client is started.
This is called on the client when the client stops.
This is called on the client when the client is finished loading a new networked scene.

parameterdescription.para: The connection that finished loading a new networked scene.

briefdescription.para: Called on the client when adding a player to the room fails.

detaileddescription.para: This could be because the room is full, or the connection is not allowed to have more players.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked for NetworkBehaviour objects when they become active on the server.

detaileddescription.para: This could be triggered by NetworkServer.Listen() for objects in the scene, or by NetworkServer.Spawn() for objects that are dynamically created.
This will be called for objects on a "host" as well as for object on a dedicated server.

briefdescription.para: Invoked on the server when the object is unspawned

detaileddescription.para: Useful for saving object data in persistant storage

briefdescription.para: Called on every NetworkBehaviour when it is activated on a client.

detaileddescription.para: Objects on the host have this function called, as there is a local client on the host. The values of SyncVars on object are guaranteed to be initialized correctly with the latest state from the server when this function is called on the client.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on clients when the server has caused this object to be destroyed.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used as a hook to invoke effects or do client specific cleanup.

briefdescription.para: Called when the local player object has been set up.

detaileddescription.para: This happens after OnStartClient(), as it is triggered by an ownership message from the server. This is an appropriate place to activate components or functionality that should only be active for the local player, such as cameras and input.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on behaviours that have authority, based on context and NetworkIdentity.hasAuthority.

detaileddescription.para: This is called after OnStartServer and before OnStartClient.

When NetworkIdentity.AssignClientAuthority is called on the server, this will be called on the client that owns the object. When an object is spawned with NetworkServer.Spawn with a NetworkConnection parameter included, this will be called on the client that owns the object.

briefdescription.para: This is invoked on behaviours when authority is removed.

detaileddescription.para: When NetworkIdentity.RemoveClientAuthority is called on the server, this will be called on the client that owns the object.

briefdescription.para: This is a hook that is invoked on all player objects when entering the room.

detaileddescription.para: Note: isLocalPlayer is not guaranteed to be set until OnStartLocalPlayer is called.

briefdescription.para: This is a hook that is invoked on all player objects when exiting the room.
This is a hook that is invoked on clients when the index changes.
This is a hook that is invoked on clients when a RoomPlayer switches between ready or not ready.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when the a client player calls SendReadyToBeginMessage() or SendNotReadyToBeginMessage().

parameterdescription.para: Whether the player is ready or not.

briefdescription.para: This is a specialized NetworkManager that includes a networked room. The room has slots that track the joined players, and a maximum player count that is enforced. It requires that the NetworkRoomPlayer component be on the room player objects. NetworkRoomManager is derived from NetworkManager, and so it implements many of the virtual functions provided by the NetworkManager class.

detaileddescription.para: This component works in conjunction with the NetworkRoomManager to make up the multiplayer room system. The RoomPrefab object of the NetworkRoomManager must have this component on it. This component holds basic room player data required for the room to function. Game specific data for room players can be put in other components on the RoomPrefab or in scripts derived from NetworkRoomPlayer.
